newsletter.subject: OUTDOORS COUNTS ON ZWIFT!
newsletter.body: You’ve already connected your Garmin account—nice work! To make sure your outdoor rides automatically sync to Zwift Companion, you’ll need to disconnect and reconnect your account in Zwift Connections. Once you’ve reconnected your account, you’ll: ✔ Earn bonus XP ✔ Keep your Weekly Streak alive ✔ See all your training progress in one place Be sure to check all permissions when you reconnect so your outdoor activity data flows in correctly.

OUTDOORS NOW COUNTS ON ZWIFT!
newsletter.body: You’ve already connected your Garmin or Wahoo account—nice work! To make sure your outdoor rides continue to count toward your XP, Weekly Streaks, and Training Score, you’ll need to disconnect and reconnect your account in Zwift Connections. Be sure to check all permissions when you reconnect so your outdoor activity data flows in correctly. That way, every ride—indoors or out—keeps working toward your goals. For more information, check our support article.

personal.subject: catch up
personal.body: Hi Greg, I hope all’s well with you—it’s been some time since our paths crossed at Investec Asset Management (or rather, Ninety One as it’s now known). I hope you don’t mind me reaching out again after all this time. I’ve been following Alpha’s journey with keen interest, particularly as the role of AI in investment management begins to shift from theoretical to transformational...

billing.Subject: Update on HMRC Making Tax Digital changes
billing.ContentSummary: The way income tax self assessment returns are submitted with HMRC is changing. Making Tax Digital (MTD) for Income Tax will require sole traders, the self employed and landlords with qualifying income to maintain digital records and update HMRC each quarter as opposed to submitting one annual tax return.
